description: Strengthen the anterior chain (front) of your body, focusing on quads, hip flexors, core, chest, and shoulders. This higher-intensity Vinyasa flow explores arm balances throughout practice, as well as Plank variations, Lunges, Boat Pose, chest openers, and gentle stretches. We recommend complementing this class with Posterior Strength Flow for a comprehensive practice. This class previously aired on February 8, 2023.

title: Root To Rise Flow
description: Explore a common yoga phrase, “root to rise,” to understand the actions to take and what this expression actually means. This comprehensive Vinyasa practice includes the mechanics of Down Dog, Forearm Plank, Side Plank progressions, Eka Pada Koundinyasana II (arm balance), and Pigeon Pose. This class previously aired on February 6, 2023.

title: Strong Legs Hatha
description: Strengthen and stabilize your lower body in this Hatha practice that explores dynamic movement in your legs, including harder-to-access areas. Begin with mobility stretches followed by Crescent Lunge, Chair, Side Angle Pose, Warrior II, Horse Pose, Triangle, and One-Legged Bridge. This class previously aired on January 23, 2023.

title: Principles Of Vinyasa Flow
description: Familiarize yourself with the principles of Vinyasa — tempo, Ujjayi breathing, and Sun Salutations — to better understand and build a sustainable flow-based practice. After going over pose foundations and introducing breathwork, put everything together in a full-body strength-building flow with Lunges, Chaturanga, Warrior II, Side Angle, and Plank. This class previously aired on January 16, 2023.

title: Energize Your Day Flow
description: Energize your mind and body in this feel-good practice that flows through fluid movement and strength-builders. Enjoy minimal instruction halfway through class, allowing you to tune into your experience. Highlights include Sun Salutations, Lunges, Dancer Pose, Side Plank, Bow, and Eka Pada Rajakapotasana II (One-Legged Pigeon Pose). This class previously aired on February 1, 2023.

title: Find Core Strength Flow
description: Strengthen, stabilize, and reach all areas of your core through dynamic holds and sequences that focus all action (safely) in your center. Begin with core activation using a block, then flow through Sun Salutations, Forearm Plank, Side Planks, Boat Pose, Revolved Chair, and Sphinx Pose. This class previously aired on January 30, 2023.

title: Renewal Series: Stay Motivated Flow
description: Find the motivation to move toward your long-term practice goals by flowing through this feel-good, strengthening class. Gomukhasana, Boat Pose, Dancer’s Pose, and Skandasana prepare you to peak in Flying Pigeon (arm balance), Hanumanasana (Full Split), and Lotus Pose. This is a great practice to repeat to measure your progress over time. This class previously aired on January 25, 2023, and is the last class in Jason’s 4-part Renewal Series designed to kickstart the new year with fresh energy.

title: Renewal Series: Recharge Flow
description:
Focus on your spine’s mobilization in all of its capabilities to cultivate a sense of renewal. Gear up for sustained movement; the intensity of this class comes from continuously flowing rather than the complexity of postures. Key poses include Revolved Lunge, Revolved Half Moon, Humble Warrior, Pigeon, and Wheel Pose. This class previously aired on January 18, 2023, and is the third class in Jason’s 4-part Renewal Series designed to kickstart the new year with fresh energy. 

Please note: Jason is working through an injury at the time of this class, so while he doesn’t physically demonstrate, he uses detailed verbal cues to make it easy for you to follow along.

title: Renewal Series: Self-Regulation Hatha
description: This class dives into self-regulation, an aspect of yoga that calls you to observe and be aware, by sharpening your focus in standing postures and tuning into your breath and sensations with balances and inversions. Practice Warrior II, Revolved Half Moon, Eagle Pose, Figure Four Chair, Forearm Stand, Shoulderstand, and Gomukhasana. This class previously aired on January 11, 2023, and is the second class in Jason’s 4-part Renewal Series designed to kickstart the new year with fresh energy.

title: Renewal Series: Get Clear Hatha
description: This class emphasizes inversions and backbends to focus your thoughts and finish with a clear mind. Key poses include Low Lunges, Pigeon, Camel, Forearm Stand, Bridge, Wheel, and Shoulderstand. This class previously aired on January 4, 2023, and is the first class in Jason’s 4-part Renewal Series designed to kickstart the new year with fresh energy.

title: Full Body Vinyasa
description: This Vinyasa class highlights each region of your body while in postures so that you can develop a deeper awareness of the mechanics of movement. Practice Plank and Side Plank, Handstand Hops, Extended Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose, and Forearm Stand, then finish in seated meditation. This class previously aired on January 2, 2023.

title: Recovery Day Flow
description: Add this class to your weekly routine to balance out your practice; you’ll focus on moving differently from day-to-day patterns and allow yourself active relaxation. Enjoy reclined postures with a strap, seated twists, Malasana, Half Salutations, Horse Pose, Wide-Legged Forward Fold, and Skandasana. This class previously aired on December 28, 2022.

title: Find Your Routine Flow
description: Set yourself up for success with a practice you can return to regularly. This class equips you with the knowledge of why we do the things we do in class to deepen your relationship with your practice, making it easier to build a routine. Highlights include Sun Salutations, Warriors, Half Moon, Camel, Pigeon, and a seated twist. This class previously aired on January 9, 2023.

title: Self-Accountability Flow
description: Cultivate self-trust and accountability in this class that supports you in ‘flowing on your own.’ Start with guidance for structure, then enjoy quiet space to make this practice your own, but don’t worry, Jason continues to move throughout class for you to follow along if needed. You can explore Puppy Pose, Sun Salutations, Warrior II, Triangle, Half Moon, and seated meditation. This class previously aired on December 19, 2022.

title: Neck & Shoulder Relief Hatha
description: Unlock and release tension in your neck and shoulders by using conventional postures in unconventional ways. Begin with kneeling stretches and Puppy Pose, then practice Side Angle, Sphinx, and Low Lunge with Eagle Arms before finishing refreshed in seated twists. This class previously aired on December 5, 2022.

title: Revolve Your Flow
description: Explore binds and arm balances in this progressive twist-based flow. Warm your body with Sun Salutation variations to prepare for a twisting sequence that leads you to round out with backbends or forward bends. Peak poses include revolved standing postures, Side Crow, Eka Pada Koundinyasana (arm balance), Astavakrasana (arm balance), and Inverted Staff Pose. This class previously aired on December 14, 2022.

title: Calm & Cool Flow
description: This fulfilling flow is filled with nourishing twists, side bends, and mobility-boosting movement to support you in feeling better in body and mind. Poses include Lizard, Half Splits, Locust, Skandasana, Goddess Squat, and Gomukhasana. This class previously aired on December 7, 2022.

title: Still The Mind Hatha
description: If the title of this class piqued your interest, chances are your mind could use some stillness. Calm your thoughts with a steady breath pattern, slow movement, and long holds. Warm up with Sun Salutations, then practice Revolved Low Lunge, an inversion of your choice, Child’s Pose, backbends, seated folds, and reclined twists. This class previously aired on November 21, 2022.

title: Increase Flexibility Flow
description: Enjoy this classic, stretchy Vinyasa practice that reaches your hamstrings, quads, hips, and shoulders to create more malleability. Flow through Lunges, Malasana, Figure Four Chair, Goddess Squat, Warrior II, and Wide-Legged Forward Fold before cooling down with seated postures. This class previously aired on November 16, 2022.

title: Flow To Hurdler Pose
description: This Vinyasa practice targets your hips, legs, and core strength to prepare you for Eka Pada Koundinyasana II (Hurdler Pose) and other arm balances in this realm. Move through Lizard, Malasana, Bound Side Angle, Eka Pada Koundinyasana I, Crow Pose, and Full Splits to peak strongly in Eka Pada Koundinasana II. This class previously aired on November 28, 2022.

title: Focus The Mind Flow
description: This challenging practice focuses on your breath and maintains a steady pace, but with minimal cueing, so that you can restore calmness to your mind. Postures include One-Legged Plank, Warrior III, Handstand, Eka Pada Koundinyasana II (arm balance), Firelog, and a Heron Pose variation. This class previously aired on December 12, 2022.

title: Purposeful Precision Hatha
description: This Hatha class features in-depth explanations of techniques to support all levels of yogis and teachers; maximize the benefits of your practice through focused attention, efficiency, and precision. Postures include Wide-Angle Seated Forward Bend, Warrior I & II, Side Angle, Triangle, Forearm Stand, and Camel Pose. This class previously aired on October 31, 2022.

title: Subtle Shifts Hatha
description: Troubleshoot your alignment and positioning to positively impact arm balances, inversions, backbends, and your entire practice. This Hatha class moves through warm-up Sun Salutations, Crow & Side Crow Pose, Lizard, Eka Pada Koundinyasana, and Wheel with directions for small course corrections. This class previously aired on November 14, 2022.

title: Strong Core Flow
description: Focus on building strength in your (anterior) core in the context of a Vinyasa flow. This tough and intense practice begins with Reclined Crow and Boat poses, moves through Forearm Plank, Chair, and Side Crow, then finishes with Pigeon and Supta Baddha Konasana. This class previously aired on November 23, 2022.

title: Declutter Your Mind Hatha
description: This class calms your mind by calling you to tune into sensations and focus on the action of movement, equipping you as both the giver and receiver of your practice’s benefits. Check in with where you’re at mentally, then move through a seated series with Heron Pose, Lizard Lunge, Pigeon, an inversion of your choice, and Bridge. This class previously aired on October 26, 2022.

title: Essential Spinal Movements Flow
description: This slow and steady flow takes you through an assortment of spinal movements — extensions, flexions, and rotations — for an essential refresh. Practice Down Dog variations, Revolved Crescent Lunge, Side Crow, Gate Pose, and Camel Pose before finishing in meditation or Savasana. This class previously aired on October 18, 2022.

title: Stay Engaged Hatha
description: This Hatha class presents a change of pace, encouraging you to work on scaling your effort. Explore 1-3 minute holds in postures to create a static approach to an active practice. Highlights include Down Dog, Handstand and Headstand (wall optional), Triangle, Warriors, Chair, Forearm Plank, and Bridge. This class previously aired on October 17, 2022.

title: Steady Breath Flow
description: Follow a steady-paced flow with minimal cueing to deepen your focus and presence. Begin with Forearm Plank and Chair, then practice Handstand hops, Warriors, Crow Pose, and Inverted Staff Pose before finishing with supine twists. This challenging flow is a great go-to for experienced yogis or teachers. This class previously aired on October 24, 2022.

title: Psoas Release Hatha
description: Soothe your body and release tightness in your psoas with hip extensions, lateral bends, and strengthening elements. This slow-moving yet challenging Hatha practice includes Supported Bridge, Gomukhasana, Crescent Moon, Side Plank, and Yoga Nidra (a guided, reclined relaxation). This class previously aired on September 28, 2022.

title: Simple & Grounded Hatha
description: This go-to, everyday class is filled with Jason’s favorite fundamental postures and offers the approach of doing simple things regularly and skillfully. Practice Lizard Lunge, Pigeon, Pyramid, Revolved Triangle, Dolphin or Headstand, Bridge, and Shoulder Stand to finish feeling grounded. This class previously aired on October 5, 2022.

title: Lower Body Tune-Up Flow
description: Target hard-to-reach areas in your legs, from your hips to your ankles and feet, with a range of lunges and opening postures. Start with kneeling stretches, then move into Locust, Crescent Lunge, Humble Warrior, Pigeon, and Skandasana. We suggest pairing this class with a restorative class to deepen the benefits. This class previously aired on October 12, 2022.

title: Abandon Comfort Zone Flow
description: Expand your comfort zone as you shake up familiar patterns in this fast-paced flow. Move through Sun Salutations and lean into your edge with energizing postures like balancing Half Moon, Handstand, Forearm Stand, and Wheel Pose, then finish in Supta Baddha Konasana. This class previously aired on October 10, 2022.

title: Beyond The Pose: Flow For Aparigraha
description: This is the fifth of ten classes in our Beyond The Pose Series, which explores Classical Yoga: The 10 Ethical Principles (5 Yamas and 5 Niyamas) that originate in Patanjali’s Yoga Sutras (200 CE) to integrate yogic values into your everyday life. This all-around-flow-based practice highlights the last Yama, Aparigraha (non-attachment), by asking you to let go of expectations and noticing that your practice does not need to prove anything, it will still take care of you. Challenge yourself through Sun Salutations, Handstand Hops, arm balances, Forearm Stand, and Full Split. This class previously aired on November 11, 2022.

title: Hip Mobility Hatha
description: Increase your mobility by practicing a range of motion in key postures to strengthen your hips and surrounding stabilizing muscles. Explore reclined leg and hip stretches, Boat Pose, Figure Four Chair, a series of Pigeon variations, Forearm Stand, and Wide-Legged Seated Forward Fold. This class previously aired on September 19, 2022.

title: Flow With Vigor
description: Establish a steady breath-to-movement pattern while flowing through a Vinyasa sequence that builds from the beginning to the end of class — continuous but not rushed. This robust and skillful practice includes Lunges, Balancing Plank, Revolved Half Moon, Fallen Triangle, Warrior III, and Camel Pose. This class previously aired on October 3, 2022.

title: Feel Good Flow
description: This energizing Vinyasa flow will unravel tension and leave your body simply feeling good. Start in Wide-Legged Seated Forward Fold, then flow through a range of leg and side-body stretchy postures, including Crescent Moon, Fallen Star, Standing Forward Fold, and Triangle. This class previously aired on September 26, 2022.

title: Prep For Inversions Hatha
description: Familiarize yourself with the technique of four fundamental inversions: Handstand, Forearm Stand, Headstand, and Shoulder Stand. Build the skill and confidence to go upside down by introducing your muscles to the blueprint of these postures — one at a time, with time to practice each — using Plank Pose, shoulder stretches, and Dolphin variations. This class previously aired on September 14, 2022.

title: Daily Maintenance Flow
description: This comprehensive practice focuses on your breath while balancing your body using efficient and effective poses. Begin with shoulder stretches and Boat Pose, then move through Revolved Low Lunge, Forearm Plank, and Figure Four Chair followed by an inversion (optional) and backbends. This class previously aired on September 12, 2022.

title: Breathe & Balance Hatha
description: Warm up with a Vinyasa-style flow to connect with your breath, then transition into a Hatha sequence filled with standing and seated balances. This steady class fine-tunes your focus while practicing Plank holds, Dancer’s Pose, Half Moon variations, Extended Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose, and a seated straddle balance (Ubhaya Konasana). This class previously aired on August 24, 2022.

title: New To The Mat Flow
description: Gain an approachable understanding of what the body is doing through postures and sequences in a Vinyasa flow-like practice; a great class for beginners or teachers looking to acquire tools for leading new students. Begin with a breakdown of postures, then thread them together to form a sequence. Poses include Low Lunge, Chair, Warrior II, Locust, Boat, and Savasana. This class previously aired on September 5, 2022.

title: Mental Inventory Flow
description: From the get-go, this steady flow helps you shift your state of mind by focusing on the sensations in your breath and body. Begin by checking in with where your mood and thoughts are, then practice straddle stretches, Forearm Plank, Half Moon, Warrior II with Eagle Arms, Boat Pose, and hip-openers. This class previously aired on August 31, 2022.

title: Shoulder Opening Flow
description: This dynamic practice includes lots of arm movements that support long-term shoulder strength and mobility; a great class to return to when feeling tight in your upper body. Postures include Dolphin, Forearm Plank, Forearm Stand, Warrior II with Gomukhasana arms, Half Moon, and Side Bow. This class previously aired on September 21, 2022.

title: Rooted Twists Hatha
description: This Hatha practice moves steadily through various standing, seated, arm balancing, and inverted twist postures to unwind tension in your entire body, namely your spine and hips. Peak poses include Double Pigeon, Revolved Chair, Headstand with a twist, and Side Crow. Though comprehensive on its own, this practice would be great paired as a beginning sequence before forward- or back-bending sequences. This class previously aired on August 28, 2022.

title: Calm, Cool, Collected Hatha
description: Ground yourself through strengthening holds to promote a sense of ease throughout your entire state of being. Practice Chair Pose, Wide-Legged Forward Fold, Dolphin or an inversion of your choice, Bridge, and Seated Forward Fold to finish feeling cool, calm, and collected. This class previously aired on August 10, 2022.

title: Back To Basics Hatha
description: This informative Hatha class focuses on foundational postures, breaking them down to go in-depth for technique and to build strength — perfect for beginners or those returning to their practice. Practice Reclining Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose (with a strap), Chair Pose, Tree Pose, Triangle, Extended Side Angle, and Wide-Legged Forward Bend, finishing feeling grounded. This class previously aired on August 1, 2022.

title: Lower Body Circulation Flow
description: Get your circulation moving in your entire body by focusing on your legs. Apply an active range of motion through this strong sequence that includes Supine Leg Circles, Chair Pose, Malasana, Warrior III, and Bridge. This class previously aired on August 22, 2022.

title: Shoulder & Upper Back Recovery Flow
description: Completely refresh your upper body with comprehensive movement that nourishes your shoulders, neck, and upper back. This stretchy Vinyasa flow begins with seated Eagle Arms and Chair variations, then enjoy Lunges, Warrior II, Half Moon, and Wide-Legged Forward Bend with a twist. This class previously aired on August 17, 2022.

title: Hips & Lower Back Recovery Flow
description: Support your hips and low back with continuous, mild movement that alleviates overuse or underuse. Enjoy postures that open and unwind tension, including Ankle-To-Knee Pose, Figure Four Chair, Revolved Triangle, Pigeon, and modified Cow Face Pose. This class previously aired on August 15, 2022.

title: Hatha For Presence
description: Feel grounded and focused as you flow through postures and explore the three elements of total presence: mental state, sensation, and breath. Practice Pyramid Pose, Crescent Lunge, Chair, Standing Split, Warriors, and Compass Pose, noticing that high-sensation poses can help you stay present. This class previously aired on July 18, 2022.

title: Reset Your Neck Hatha
description: Counteract compression in your upper body with shoulder and neck releases in familiar postures. Relieve strain from slouching or long periods of gazing down with seated spinal stretches, Crescent Lunge, Pyramid, Warrior I, and Warrior III. This class previously aired on July 11, 2022.

title: Flow To Lift Off
description: Familiarize yourself with the breakdown of advanced arm balances before weaving them into a Vinyasa-style flow. Prepare your body for lift off with shoulder, core, and hip work, then practice Eka Hasta Bhujasana, Mayurasana, Astavakrasana, and Handstand. Finish with Locust Pose and a restful Savasana. This class previously aired on July 19, 2022.

title: Standing Strong Hatha
description: Practice key standing postures to build strength and technique that supports the whole of your practice. Start with Crescent Lunge Salutations, then flow steadily through Tree Pose, Revolved Triangle, Extended Side Angle, Warriors, Half Moon, and Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose. This class previously aired on June 29, 2022.

title: Regulate Your System Flow
description: Get your circulation moving with a fast-paced flow to start, then feel grounded as you slow down and settle to finish. This thorough Vinyasa practice has something for everyone and is rooted in self-awareness. Highlights include Sun Salutations, Side Plank, standing postures, Half Moon, an inversion and backbend of your choice, and Shoulder Stand. This class previously aired on July 13, 2022.

title: Counteract Compression Hatha
description: Rinse away stress and tension with a variety of elongating spinal movements, twisting poses, and side bending. Find release in this stretchy Hatha sequence that includes Revolved Crescent Lunge, Standing Forward Bend, Revolved Pyramid, and Wide-Legged Standing Forward Bend. This class previously aired on June 13, 2022.

title: Body Awareness Flow
description: This energizing Vinyasa practice focuses on opening postures that add length from head to toe. Recognize significant points throughout your body while moving steadily through Dolphin, Revolved Crescent, Triangle, Half Moon, Pigeon with a quad stretch, and Camel Pose. This class previously aired on June 22, 2022.

title: Beginner's Mind Hatha
description: Explore non-traditional variations in familiar poses and sequences to refresh your perspective on your practice, build strength, and develop technique. Postures include Crescent Lunge, Pigeon, Bow, Triangle, Extended Side Angle, and Bridge. This class previously aired on June 15, 2022.

title: Low & Slow Flow
description: When you’re feeling stiff and looking to feel good — after a long day or in recovery mode — this slow but strong Vinyasa class is for you. Follow rhythmic, consistent movement to get your energy flowing. Postures include Puppy Pose, Thread The Needle, modified Locust Pose, Heron Pose, Half Split, and Double Pigeon. This class previously aired on June 27, 2022.

title: Reduce Tension Hatha
description: Relax your mind and body in this Hatha practice that includes long holds in familiar postures accompanied by a variation of Viloma pranayama. Find your calm in Low Lunge variations, Wide-Legged Forward Fold, Hanumanasana (Monkey Pose), Pigeon, and Revolved Head-To-Knee Pose. This class was previously aired on June 6, 2022.

title: Refresh Your Mind Hatha
description: This mild yet strong Hatha class focuses on inversions, allowing stagnation in your head, neck, and jaw to flow and release. Practice Sun Salutations, Wide-Legged Forward Fold, Pigeon, Handstand or Forearm Balance, and Headstand. Pair this class with Refresh Your Mind Flow for complete mind-body effects. This class was previously aired on May 11, 2022.

title: Ease The Knees Flow
description: Focus on stretching and strengthening the areas surrounding your knees, like your quads, to create low-body stability and support. This informative flow goes back to basics, practicing Chair Pose, Locust Pose, and Low Lunge with quad stretch variations. This class was previously aired on June 1, 2022. Props Suggested: a blanket or bolster.

title: Agile Joints Flow
description: This Vinyasa practice supports agile joints with a lightly-paced flow of full-body mobility-based movement. Move through Boat Pose, Double Pigeon, standing poses, Goddess Squat, and Side Bow, then finish with a deep side bend, feeling grounded and balanced. This class was previously aired on May 25, 2022.

title: Full-Body Strengthening Flow
description: This skillful and challenging practice builds functional strength and agility in your entire body. Create heat fast with Boat Pose and Forearm Plank to start, then practice Warrior III, Handstand, and Extended Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose before finishing with One-Legged Bridge and Supta Baddha Konasana. Options are offered throughout to explore the demands on your body. This class previously aired on July 5, 2022.

title: New Year, More You Flow
description: This comprehensive Vinyasa class strengthens your ability to finish what you start, helping you to build a resilient, nourishing, and strong at-home practice. Focus on the depth of movement to prepare your body for peak poses. Start with your hips and shoulders, flow through Sun Salutations and standing postures, then explore inversions and backbends (with a range of options) before finishing with forward bends and a long Savasana. Key poses include Lizard, Dolphin, Half Moon, Handstand, Forearm Stand, and Side Plank. This class previously aired on December 31, 2022.

title: Psoas Release Hatha
description: This stretchy, satisfying Hatha class includes lots of side bending to release and elongate through your psoas. Practice supported Bridge, a Lunge series, Gate Pose, and Seated Wide-Legged Forward Fold, then finish with a relaxing, restorative Yoga Nidra. This class was previously aired on May 2, 2022. Props Suggested: 1 block.

title: Refresh Your Body Vinyasa
description: This grounding practice includes various side bends and twists with helpful cues to refresh your entire body deeply. Enjoy low body stretches, Sphinx, Forearm Plank, Crescent Lunge, and Reverse Triangle, plus the option to go upside down or arm balance. Pair this class with Refresh Your Mind Hatha for complete mind-body effects. This class was previously aired on May 9, 2022.

title: Boundless Binds Hatha
description: Work on increasing your strength and flexibility for an active range of motion in bound postures. Warm your upper body and hips, then dive into various binds in Warrior II, Triangle, Bird of Paradise, Side Plank with Half Lotus, and Marichyasana B. This class was previously aired on May 18, 2022. Props Suggested: 1 strap.

title: Flow For Resilience
description: Promote mind-body resilience by tapping into your strength while staying focused on a steady rhythm of breath. Challenge yourself while flowing through Warrior II with Eagle Arms, Triangle variations, Revolved Half Moon, and Full Splits, then finish with pranayama. This class was previously aired on April 25, 2022.

title: Sustained Strength Hatha
description: Practice long-held challenging postures, like Handstand for a full minute, to build full-body power in a new way. Explore how to sustain your strength in Chair Pose, Forearm Plank, One-Legged Crow, and Pendant Pose. This class was previously aired on April 20, 2022. Props Suggested: wall space.

title: Flow Through Transitions
description: Zero in on transitions through postures, focusing on how to maintain strength as your body moves in different directions. This challenging Vinyasa flow includes Warrior III, Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose, Hanumanasana (Splits), Crow Pose, and Eka Pada Koundinyasana (arm balance). This class was previously aired on May 16, 2022.

title: Mental Reset Flow
description: Focus on simply feeling good with satisfying movement and gentle stretches— your go-to class anytime your mind needs a refresh. Begin with side bends, Boat Pose, and Anjaneyasana, then flow through Sun Salutations (with no Chaturangas) and leg-opening postures. This class was previously aired on April 18, 2022.

title: Hatha For Presence
description: Encourage your mind to stay fully present by tuning into your movement, breath, and sensations. Focus on finding your edge as you practice Lizard Lunge, Wide-Legged Forward Bend, and Forearm Stand, then finish with seated side bends. This class was previously aired on April 11, 2022.

title: Strong Side Body Flow
description: Create more stability by tapping into ab and side body strength with creative sequencing and expansive breath. This challenging Vinyasa class includes Sun Salutations, Crescent Lunge, and Visvamitrasana. Finish with side bends in Wide-Angle Seated Forward Bend. This class was previously aired on April 27, 2022.

title: Refined Breath Flow
description: This well-rounded practice flows through non-stop, steady breath-to-movement sequences while tuning into full-body engagement. Challenge yourself with Chair and Boat holds, Standing and Full Splits, Extended Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose, Visvamitrasana, and Handstand. This class was previously aired on May 4, 2022.

title: Quiet The Mind Hatha
description: Pay close attention to your movement and technique to focus your mind, stepping away from racing thoughts. Practice Low Lunge variations, Triangle Pose, Half Moon, option for Headstand, and finish with calm, gentle stretches. This class was previously aired on March 28, 2022.

title: Strong Inversions Flow
description: Strengthen your upper body, core, and hips in a standing sequence to prepare to explore a variety of inversions and arm balances. This challenging practice includes higher-level postures like Sirsasana II, Side Crow, Handstand, and Shoulder Stand. Options are offered throughout to match your skill level. This class was previously aired on June 8, 2022.

title: Tension Release Hatha
description: Reach all tight areas in your body for a total unwind, a great complement to challenging workouts. Start with Squat and quad stretches, then move through a Lunge series, Fallen Triangle, an Eagle Arm stretch, and Cow Face Pose before finishing with a rest. This class was previously aired on March 23, 2022.

title: Strong Core Flow
description: This challenging Vinyasa class strengthens all aspects of your core to create well-rounded stability. Postures include Boat Pose, balancing Table Top, Plank work, Crow Pose variations, and Eka Hasta Bhujasana (arm balance). This class was previously aired on March 16, 2022.

title: Everything In 30 Flow
description: This concise yet all-encompassing Vinyasa class releases tension while strengthening key muscles from head to toe. Practice Sun Salutations, standing postures, Side Crow, and an inversion and backbend of your choice, then finish in Savasana. Plenty of modifications are offered to meet you where you’re at. This class was previously aired on April 6, 2022.

title: Hatha For Spaciousness
description: Gently open your body from head to toe with simple, easy movement that unwinds and releases tight areas. Find upper body stretches, hip-openers, twists, and side bends blended into postures like Low Lunge, Pigeon Pose, Malasana, and Wide-Legged Forward Fold. This class was previously aired on March 7, 2022.

title: Centered & Strong Hatha
description: Focus on strengthening your core while listening to your body to work with your intensity level. Practice variations of Boat Pose, Bird Dog crunches, Forearm Plank, and an arm balance series that peaks in Supine Firefly. This class was previously aired on February 28, 2022.

title: Full Body Refresh Flow
description: Invite minor adjustments to classic postures for an all-new, feel-good experience. Move through twists, stretches, and backbends blended into Lunge Salutations, Standing Splits, Bow Pose, Revolved Triangle, and Bridge Pose. This class was previously aired on February 16, 2022.

title: Flow for Spine Health
description: Release stiffness and stagnation in and around the entire length of your spine. Explore a wide range of motion flowing steadily through Triangle, Revolved Crescent Lunge, Sphinx, variations of Camel, and Bridge poses. This class was previously aired on March 14, 2022.

title: Back To Basics Flow
description: Zero in on your form through traditional Vinyasa flows paired with variations of fundamental postures. Move through breath-guided Sun Salutations, Warrior I & II, and Revolved Triangle, then finish in Savasana or seated meditation on your own time. This class was previously aired on March 9, 2022.

title: Hip-Focused Flow
description: Get into all areas of your hips to release tension and improve mobility. A great Vinyasa practice to come back to again and again to counter stagnation. Flow steadily through a Boat Pose series, standing Figure Four, option for Flying Pigeon Pose, then finish with a backbend and Supta Baddha Konasana. This class was previously aired on March 30, 2022.

title: Comprehensive Flow
description: Work on maintaining the integrity of your postures and presence while adding a personal challenge throughout this energizing, breath-to-movement class. Move through Sun Salutations, lots of core activation, and peak postures of Handstand, Eka Pada Koundinyasana, and Splits. This class was previously aired on April 13, 2022.

title: Lift Brain Fog Flow
description: Get into a steady Vinyasa rhythm to clear brainfog and feel more like yourself. Start with hip-openers and seated twists, then drift through a sequence with Forearm Plank, Wide-Legged Standing Forward Bend, Pyramid Pose, and option for Headstand. This class was previously aired on February 9, 2022.

title: Quiet The Mind Flow
description: Get in the zone of calming your thoughts with simple and repetitive movement. Find your rhythm with Malasana to Forward Fold, Sphinx to Forearm Plank, Low Lunge twists, Sun Salutations, and lots of stretchy postures. This class was previously aired on January 31, 2022.

title: Chaturanga-Free Flow
description: Expand your toolkit by stepping away from familiar sequences. This class focuses on building low-body strength and recreating the power you feel in Chaturanga Dandasana with other postures, including Navasana (Boat Pose), Chair Pose, Wide-Legged Squats, and Warrior I & II. This class was previously aired on March 2, 2022.

title: Psoas Refresh Hatha
description: Strengthen and restore your psoas in long-held postures that approach stretching with a different perspective. Begin by turning on your muscles with a Forearm Plank and Crescent Lunge series, then release tension in variations of Gate, Triangle, and Camel poses. This class was previously aired on January 24, 2022.

title: Strength & Stability Flow
description: Practice skillful transitions and use bodyweight as resistance in poses to strengthen your body and improve stability. This fast-paced class includes challenging variations in Boat Pose, Warrior III, Chaturanga, Side Plank, and Bridge Pose. This class was previously aired on March 21, 2022.

title: Full-Body Balance Hatha
description: Experience every part of your body working together to maximize your power and self-awareness. Move through this strengthening class that includes Half Split, High Lunge, hip-openers, and reclining arm balances, then release into meditation or Savasana.

title: Full-Body Balance: Shoulders
description: Practice a wide range of motion in your upper body to build flexibility in your shoulders. Flow through a sequence with various arm movements in Puppy Pose, High Lunges, Lizard Lunge, and Warrior II to leave your entire body feeling more strong and mobile.

title: Full-Body Balance: Upper Body
description: Create full-body mobility by strengthening your upper back. Turn on engagement in your lats and shoulders to flow through a few Crescent Lunge Salutations with long-held Locust Poses woven throughout, then practice Dancer Pose and Bridge.

title: Back in Balance Flow
description: Create a strong foundation in standing and arm balances by practicing consistent, steady breathing. This sequence invites challenge to maximize stability while in Side Plank, Half Moon, Warrior III, Dancers Pose, and Flying Pigeon. This class was previously aired on January 30, 2022.

title: Full-Body Balance: Core
description: Target your core with strengthening techniques in asanas to increase full-body stability. Generate heat throughout this entire class with Leg Lifts, Bird Dog, Plank work, and Revolved Side Angle Pose, then finish strong with reclined arm balances.

title: Full-Body Balance: Hip-Flexors & Quads
description: Tune into the specific needs of your hip-flexors and quads and how they support your entire body. Practice stretching and strengthening movements while in Boat Pose, One-Legged Down Dog, and lots of variations in Crescent Lunges, then finish with meditation or Savasana.

title: Full-Body Balance: Outer Hips
description: Build balance for your entire body by focusing your attention on your outer hips, glutes, and psoas. Use non-traditional movements in asanas to stretch and strengthen in 90/90, standing Ankle to Knee, Chair, and Pigeon poses before ending in meditation or Savasana.

title: Full-Body Balance: Hamstrings
description: Develop a wider range of full-body motion by focusing on the strength and mobility of your hamstrings. Release tension with Reclining Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose to start, then flow through a strengthening series with All Fours work, Half Split, Dancer Pose, and a final leg-stretch.

title: Heat-Building Flow
description: Push your “everyday” poses to a new level. Practice deepening and engaging your entire body while maintaining a steady pace. This sequence begins by building heat in your core, then progresses through reclined arm balances, Plank variations, Warrior II, and Boat Pose. This class was previously aired on January 19, 2022.

title: Recalibrating Vinyasa
description: Energize your body and reconnect with your mind in this steady flow. Move with intention through stretches and twists, then Dolphin Pose, Lunge Salutations, Bow Pose, Wide-Legged Forward Bend, and Half Moon. This class was previously aired on January 10, 2022.

title: Unlock Your Upper Back Hatha
description: Tap into tough to reach areas in your upper back for tension release. Begin with Eagle Arms then poses like Warrior II, Dolphin, Wide-Legged Forward Bend, and Bridge with added twists to open the back and shouders. This is a great class to counter the effects of sitting at a desk or looking down at your phone for most of the day. This class was previously aired on January 5, 2022.

title: Strong Vinyasa Flow
description: This go-to strengthening class steadily flows through a range of movement to work your entire body. Start slow with a Lunge Series, Sun Saluations, and Seated Crow Pose, then connect to your power in Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose, arm balances, and half bound Half Moon. This class was previously aired on January 26, 2022.

title: Invigorating Flow
description: A strengthening flow with minimal instruction allowing you time to focus on your body’s needs. Tuning into your breath, peak in Full Split, Bound Half Moon, Handstand, Bird of Paradise, and Flying Splits. A great class to practice time after time. This class was previously aired on February 7, 2022.

title: Energy Boost Flow
description: Flow steadily through asanas that open up areas prone to holding tension for a complete, full-body energize. Move focus from your hips, chest, and upper back in Sun Salutations and peak postures including Locust, Half Bound Triangle, Half Moon, Bow, and Camel poses. This class was previously aired on January 3, 2022.

title: Vinyasa for Grounding
description: Welcome to Day 1 of the Get to Know Glo Series. This series is just as much about getting to know our platform as it is about getting to know yourself. Use these classes as a way to set an intention for your day and to start building a practice that excites you to get on your mat. This practice focuses on building lower body strength as a way to ground your body and mind. Flow through Sun Salutations that progress through repetitive sequences with Warrior III, Boat, Chair, and Pyramid poses. This class was previously aired on January 1, 2022.

title: Advanced Backbends Flow
description: A challenging class that builds full body strength by engaging a wide range of muscles. Backbends are infused throughout this sequence including Lunge Salutations, Dancer Pose, Scorpion, Bow Pose, and King Pigeon. This class was previously aired on February 2, 2022. Props Suggested: a strap.

title: Conscious Control Hatha
description: Explore how technique and isolated adjustments can transform your strength and control in familiar asanas. Practice standing postures, then peak in Dancer Pose to Standing Hand-To-Foot, Feathered Peacock, Bridge, and Upward Facing Bow. This class was previously aired on December 18, 2021.

title: Core as a Stabilizer Hatha
description: This Hatha class concentrates on strengthening your core for improved stability and posture. Activate your abs in a sequence of Reclined Leg Lifts, Bird Dog, and Planks, then feel the core support your entire body while in Warrior II and Triangle. This class was previously aired on December 7, 2021.

title: Hydration Boost Hatha
description: This Hatha class flows through continuous movement, stretches, twists, and inversions to give your body's circulation a boost. Peak postures include Revolved Single-Legged Chair, Revolved Half Moon, Handstand, and Side Crow. This class was previously aired on December 27, 2021.

title: Everyday Strengthening Flow
description: Strengthen your entire body while having fun in your flow. This effective Vinyasa class begins with a reclined, ab-focused strengthening sequence, then blends holds and ice skaters into a standing series. Peak in Side Crow and Boat Pose before ending in seated meditation. This class was previously aired on December 20, 2021.

title: Stability & Balance Hatha
description: Generate greater stability with this core- and hip-strengthening practice that focuses on controlling transitions from balancing to standing poses. Build heat in a Plank series to start, then move through a Warrior to Half Moon sequence, Extended Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose, and Headstand. This class was previously aired on December 6, 2021.

title: Hatha for Mental Fatigue
description: Calm your mind with stress-free, yet active postures. Focus on easing tension in your shoulders and hips to feel mind-body relaxation effects. Poses include Dolphin, Lizard Lunge, Headstand, Pigeon, and Wide-Legged Forward Fold. This class was previously aired on November 29, 2021.

title: Expansive Heart Flow
description: If you’re feeling stiff or lethargic, this class will refresh your entire body. Find expansion through light, heart-opening back bends woven throughout Low Lunge Salutations, Warrior II, and Triangle. Then practice Wheel Pose to Inverted Staff Pose before ending in meditation. This class was previously aired on November 26, 2021.

title: Clear & Grounded Flow
description: This practice is less about technicality and more about flowing and syncing your breath to movement. Ground down with strong postures including Locust, Triangle, Bound Extended Side Angle, and Warrior II with Eagle arms. This class was previously aired on December 13, 2021.

title: Comprehensive Core Flow
description: Strengthen your complete core thoroughly using intentional movement in this Vinyasa class. Follow a steady flow with core-focused poses including high and low Boat Pose, Side Plank, Side Crow, and Leg-Over-Shoulder Pose. This class was previously aired on November 22, 2021.

title: Spacious Side Body Hatha
description: Feel a full-body refresh in this mild Hatha practice with lots of side bends. Unwind and release tension from your hips to your shoulders with grounding and opening postures including Gate Pose, Wide-Legged Standing Forward Bend, and Triangle. This class was previously aired on November 15, 2021.

title: Vitality Flow
description: Practice self-regulating your mind and body in this energy-moving class. Flow through variations of Surya Namaskars with Boat and Dancer poses before peaking in One-Legged King Pigeon. This class was previously aired on October 25, 2021.

title: Hatha for Mental Fatigue
description: Nourish your exhausted mind with long-held postures to help balance your thoughts. Flow through Sun Salutations then peak in Wide-Legged Forward Bend with option for Headstand, a backbend of your choice, and Heron’s Pose. This class was previously aired on October 18, 2021.

title: Full-Body Reboot Flow
description: Refresh from head to toe with energizing stretches, strong balances, and leg-opening postures. Flow with your breath in Lunge Salutations, then Dancer, Pigeon, High Boat, and Bridge poses. Return to this class every time you’re feeling like you need to reboot. This class was previously aired on December 30, 2021.

title: Refreshed Tissues Hatha
description: This Hatha practice reaches all the ignored, stuck spots in your body leaving you feeling refreshed, open, and grounded. Move through lots of hip, shoulder, and side body openers in a seated sequence then Low Lunge Salutations peaking with variations in Wide Squat and Headstand. Complete your release in Savasana. This class was previously aired on October 4, 2021.

title: Flow to Elevate Energy
description: This revitalizing flow emphasizes backbends for a feel-good full-body refresh. Practice reclined arm balances and strong Crescent Salutations working into a peak pose of Eka Pada Koundinyasana II (arm balance). This class was previously aired on September 27, 2021.

title: Intro to Yoga Flexibility
description: Feel the benefits of using a stretchy yoga sequence to supplement your workout. Designed specifically for active bodies, this flow focuses on releasing tension in your entire body. Practice various stretches in poses like Reclining Hand-To-Big-Toe, standing hip-hurdles, Crescent Lunge, and Warrior 2, all made accessible with the use of props. Props Required: a strap and wall space.

title: Hatha for a Racing Mind
description: This Hatha practice centers your mind through calming poses to synchronize movement with racing thoughts. Use a soft gaze as you flow through Surya Namaskar A, Warrior II, Triangle, and Headstand. Finish with seated stretches including Cow Face Pose. This class was previously aired on September 20, 2021.

title: Fall in Love with Your Practice Again
description: Fall in love with your practice (again) with this strengthening Vinyasa class that offers supportive space for self-guided “flow on your own” moments. Begin this stretchy sequence with a Half Moon series that peaks in Visvamitrasana (arm balance) and Wheel. Cool down with twists and forward bends before a final Savasana or seated meditation. This class was previously aired on September 22, 2021.

title: Full Flow
description: Get a full Vinyasa flow for stretching, strengthening, and mindfulness with this energizing and sweaty sequence. Poses include Warrior III, Revolved Triangle, Extended Hand-to-Big-Toe, One Legged Bridge, and Wheel. Complete your practice with a seated core strengthening routine and hip-opening stretches. This class was previously aired on September 13, 2021.

title: Hatha for Patience
description: Strengthen your mind-body patience as you concentrate your thoughts on bodily sensations through a hamstring and hip-opening flow. Postures include Reclined Half Happy Baby, Revolved Head-To-Knee Pose, modified Sun Salutations, and inversion of your choice. Finish grounded with a seated meditation. This class was previously aired on November 1, 2021. Props Suggested: 1 strap.

title: Hatha for a Present Mind
description: Through refined technique and sharp focus, this Hatha class steadies your wandering mind. Find balance in your flow through postures including Crescent Lunge Twist, Standing Hip Openers, Headstand, and Forearm Balance. End with a seated meditation, solidifying your presence. The class was previously aired on August 10, 2021.

title: Flow for Feeling Stiff
description: Release tension and facilitate circulation with this light flow that focuses on repetition and consistency. No long holds or intense postures in this flow, just steady dynamic movement. Begin by warming up your lower body with easy Sun Salutations including Standing Wide-Legged Forward Fold, then finish with shoulder extensions and seated Eagle Pose for shoulder and spine mobility. This class was previously streamed on August 3, 2021.

title: Hatha for Resilience
description: This advanced Hatha class guides you in connecting to your breath for mind-body tension relief. The sequence builds strength and balance in Plank, Forearm Balance, Full Splits, and Flying Pigeon Pose. Complete your practice in Savasana. This class was previously aired on August 24, 2021. Props Suggested: a wall.

title: Healthy Psoas Flow
description: This Vinyasa class focuses on the psoas, the deep-seated core muscle that connects the lumbar spine to the femur. A strong, healthy, and flexible psoas improves posture and helps stabilize the spine to prevent low-back and pelvic pain. This class works on releasing tension in your hips and quads while finding strength in your glutes and hamstrings. Apply this balance of strength and flexibility to poses like Warrior III, Dancer’s, and Floor Bow. This class was previously recorded on June 28, 2021.

title: Shoulder Mobility Flow
description: Maximize mobility in your shoulders with twists and binds woven throughout this energizing Vinyasa sequence. Flow through Sun Salutations incorporating Crescent Lunge, Dolphin, Warrior II, Triangle, and Wide Leg Forward Bend for full flexibility. Finish with seated stretches and a meditation. This class was previously recorded on August 10, 2021.

title: Grounding Flow
description: Discover stability in your practice with this grounding Vinyasa flow. Move through a standing series with Sun Salutations featuring High Lunge, and Forward Fold. Finish with Half Pigeon and seated twists. This class was previously aired on October 11, 2021.

title: Spinal Mobility Hatha
description: This Hatha class offers dynamic movement for healthy spinal mobility and recovery, specifically the thoracic spine. Begin with Sun C’s and side bends prepare the body for forward bends, backbends, and twisting Crescent, Half Camel, Bridge, and Wheel Pose. End with a few simple forward bends before releasing into Savasana. This class was previously streamed on June 22, 2021.

title: Shoulder Deep Dive Hatha
description: This Hatha practice focuses on building active range of motion and end-range strength in your shoulders, and teaches the key techniques that will help prepare for Forearm Balance. Begin with a dynamic shoulder warm-up, Puppy Pose, Locust, a rotator cuff strengthener, then “long” and “short” Dolphin before Forearm Balance. This class was previously streamed on June 21, 2021.

title: Supportive Core Flow
description: A foundational Vinyasa flow that focuses on how the core can support your practice. Use the anterior core in transitions and the rotational core for twists. Warm up with supine leg lifts and Forearm Plank, then flow through a Revolved Crescent Lunge and Revolved Chair sequence. Finish with Half Lord of the Fish Pose, Seated Forward Fold, and Reclined Bound Angle Pose. This class was previously recorded on June 21, 2021.

title: Fullness of Core Hatha
description: This advanced practice builds strength and stability in the core by activating both the anterior and posterior abdominals. Explore the power of the breath as it relates to the core. Peak poses include Eka Pada Koundinyasana I and Parsva Bakasana. This class was previously streamed on June 24, 2021.

title: Comprehensive Flow
description: Increase full body strength, stamina, and flexibility with this complete go-to Vinyasa class. This steady flow includes upper body openers, balancing and core strengthening poses, leg stretches, and baby backbends. Flow through Sun Salutations complimented by Crescent Lunge, Pyramid, Standing Split, Extended Hand-To-Toe, Warrior III, Half Moon, and Camel. Finish your practice with Pigeon and Savasana. This class was previously aired on August 31, 2021.

title: Energy Boost Flow
description: This energizing Vinyasa focuses on maintaining a steady state of breathing while practicing a progressively intensifying sequence with whole-body openers and strengtheners. Peak poses include Cow Face Pose, Flying Splits, Camel Pose, Upward Bow Pose, and a final seated meditation. This class was previously streamed on May 17, 2021.

title: Body-Mind Tune-Up Hatha
description: This Hatha class focuses on releasing tension in the back and outer hips by attuning the mind to the sensations of the body. Peak poses include Pigeon, Crescent Salutation, Gate Pose, and a seated meditation. This class was previously streamed on May 3, 2021.

title: Settle the Mind Flow
description: This Vinyasa class is a full-body flow that uses continuous movement and steady breath to quiet mental and emotional chatter. Peak poses include standing balances like Dancer’s, Eagle Pose, and Warrior III. This class was previously streamed on June 17, 2021.

title: Flow for Circulation
description: A go-to Vinyasa practice when you want to move your entire body, boost your energy, and increase your circulation. Peak poses include Crescent Lunge, Warrior III, Handstand, Dolphin, and Half Moon Pose. Finish class with a constructive rest and final Savasana. This class was previously streamed on June 10, 2021.

title: Strong Foundations Flow
description: This is a classic Vinyasa flow with a balanced sequence of familiar poses followed by light core work to wind down. Peak poses include Crescent Pose, Extended Side Angle, Triangle, and Half Moon Pose. This class was previously streamed on May 24, 2021.

title: Flow for Longevity
description: A Vinyasa flow that focuses on sustainable movement and increases circulation, strength, and mobility throughout the entire body. Peak poses include Bird-Dog, Chair Pose, Crescent Lunge with twist, Forearm Plank, and Bridge. This class was previously streamed on May 10, 2021.

title: Binding Basics
description: A Hatha class that teaches the fundamentals of safe, effective binding in yoga postures while achieving greater mobility in the the shoulders, neck, and upper back. Begin by warming up the shoulders with active range of motion, then a series of Crescent Lunge Salutations with Gomukhasana Arms, before building up to a peak pose of a Full Bind in Warrior II. This class was previously streamed on April 5, 2021.

title: Lower Body Strength Flow
description: This class will build greater strength, stamina, and skill in the lower body, especially the quadriceps, hip-flexors, hamstrings, and glutes. Peak poses include Crescent Salutations, Chair Pose, Half Split, and Standing Ankle-to-Knee. This class was previously streamed on April 26, 2021.

title: Strength for Backbends Vinyasa
description: An energizing flow with postures focusing on the lower body for strengthening backbends. Move through a strong series of Reformed Anjeneyasana or Low Lunge Salutations with Locust, and Natarajasana or Dancer pose, and Revolved Half Moon and Bow for building glute strength. This class was previously streamed on March 9, 2021.

title: Alignment Hatha
description: A Hatha class that focuses on attuning your shoulder alignment. This sequence includes Crescent, Sphinx, Plank, and an optional Forearmstand and Handstand. This class was previously streamed on April 19, 2021.

title: Strong Focused Flow
description: This advanced flow builds strength throughout the entire body and allows you to explore more challenging postures with an added focus of recognizing and honoring your limits. Work into standing balances including Humble Warrior, Warrior III, and Hand to Big Toe Pose, then play around with Crow Pose variations. This class was previously recorded on June 28, 2021.

title: Daily Reset Flow
description: Recalibrate with a steady-paced flow filled with twists and bends to move new energy throughout the body.  Peak poses include Revolved Triangle, Three-Legged Down Dog, and Vishnu’s Couch. This class was previously streamed on April 1, 2021.

title: Upper Body Stretch Vinyasa
description: A comprehensive shoulder-opening sequence that helps relieve tension and strengthen the upper back through Crescent Lunge and Anjeneyasana Salutations with variations of Locust and Dolphin to open the upper body. This class was previously streamed on March 18, 2021.

title: Manage Knee Pain With Your Practice
description: Learn how to identify and alleviate knee pain using specific poses in your practice. Begin with a discussion on how to recognize and respond to knee pain, then follow along with a variety of poses like Pigeon, Half-Lotus, Full-Lotus that can all help to alleviate knee pain. Tune in to how your lower body feels and learn how it is connected to prevent discomfort in your practice. Props Suggested: 1 bolster, 1 blanket.

title: Full-Body Hatha
description: A progressive Hatha practice that focuses on each region of the body, beginning with the feet, then moving through the hips, core, and finally, the shoulders. Includes Low Lunge Salutation series, Dancer pose, Planks, Chest and Heart-Openers. This class was previously streamed on January 26, 2021.

title: Peaceful Sleep Practice
description: This class releases physical and mental tension to promote a more peaceful night of sleep. It integrates calming breathwork, gentle postures like Forward Folds, and hip and shoulder openers.

title: Care for Core Vinyasa Flow
description: A strong, comprehensive flow that focuses on strengthening the entire circumference of the core through Reclined Leg Lifts, Plank variations, and invigorating twists in Surya Namaskar. This class was previously streamed on February 17, 2021.

title: Heart Expanding Vinyasa Flow
description: A steady flow focused on creating space, freedom, and mobility in the upper back and shoulders through a Crescent Lunge Salutation series, Locust, Bow, and Bridge poses. This class was previously streamed on February 10, 2021.

title: Everyday, Pick-Me-Up Vinyasa Flow
description: A twist on the classic Vinyasa flow to wake up the body and inspire the mind. Great for all levels with Salutations that focus specifically on active range of motion including Crescent Salutations, classic Surya Namaskar B, Anjeneyasana, Warrior II, Bridge, and Apanasana. This class was previously streamed on February 3, 2021.

title: Thoughtful Transitions Flow
description: The slower pace of this class allows you to pay close attention to the transitions between poses. By practicing methodical movement, we build strength, awareness, and patience. Warm up with Surya Namaskara B, then weave in balancing poses like Warrior III, Ardha Chandrasana, Crow, and Handstand hops. Round out class with Pigeon, Seated Spinal Twist, and a final Savasana. This class was previously streamed on January 31, 2020.

title: Hatha Backbend Workshop
description: A comprehensive Hatha practice for every level that prepares the shoulders, hips, and spine for a balanced progression fo backbends. Move through a workshop-style class including a Crescent Lunge series, Anjeneyasana Low Lunge Salutations, Camel, Bridge, Bow, then wind down with Supta Padangusthasana or Reclining Hand to Big Toe to safely stretch the hamstrings. This class was previously streamed on March 25, 2021.

title: Nurture Your Knees Hatha
description: A slow-paced practice for knees that need a little extra TLC. This class teaches how to engage your knees for added support in Down Dog and Tadasana, while also protecting them in more challenging poses like Lunges, Warriors, and Bridge. Today is day 5 of Glo's 30-Day-At-Home Yoga Challenge and this class was previously streamed on January 5, 2021.

title: New Year Vinyasa Flow
description: Nothing better than a refreshing flow to breathe new life into the body and kickstart the New Year. This steady-paced Vinyasa begins with a challenging Lunge series then moves though Surya A & B with Standing Ankle-to-Knee pose. Focus on opening the entire body to leave feeling rejuvenated and ready for the year ahead. Today is Day 1 of Glo's 30-Day At-Home Yoga Challenge and this class was previously streamed on January 1, 2021.

title: Happy Hamstrings Vinyasa
description: This flow is ideal for beginners who want to create more flexibility and functionality in their hamstrings. Today is day 12 of Glo's 30-Day-At-Home Yoga Challenge and this class was previously streamed on January 12, 2021.

title: Refreshing Mobility Hatha
description: A Hatha class that emphasizes dynamic movement and active range of motion through Uttihita Hasta Padangusthasana and Gomukhasana to increase mobility in the hips and shoulders. This class was previously streamed on February 24, 2021.

title: Strong Vinyasa Flow
description: An energizing series complete with standing postures, arm balances, and backbends. Students learn how to perfect their technique and find pause in challenging poses. Today is day 19 of Glo's 30-Day-At-Home Yoga Challenge and this class was previously streamed on January 19, 2021.

title: Breath-Focused Hip Release Hatha
description: Learn how to unwind the full circumference of the hips through movement and steady breathing. Begin with 90/90s and a series of Lunges to warm up the body before Standing Hip-Openers. End with Revolved Pigeon, Upavistha Konasana or Wide-Angle Seated Forward Bend, and a long Savasana to de-stress the mind and refresh the body. This class was previously recorded on December 15, 2020.

title: Vinyasa Flow for Energy
description: Meditation isn’t always done in stillness. This energizing flow is designed for you to tune into your mind and body through a steady, continuous flow. You’ll find fewer technical details and more rhythmic, repetitive movement and breathwork in this class as you fluidly move through flowing sequences followed by breathwork and a constructive rest. This class was previously streamed on December 30, 2020.

title: Kickstart Your Energy
description: Stimulate your energy with this simple, 20-minute movement-based practice that incorporates opening postures and purifying breathwork. Warm up on Hands and Knees then Bicycles and Lunge Salutes to fire up the core. A fast-paced Warrior flow keeps the heart rate pumping. Finish your practice with balancing breathwork and a mindful meditation that leaves you feeling focused and energized in mind and body.

title: Energizing Backbend Hatha
description: How often do you bend backward in your day-to-day life? Physically and figuratively. Practicing regular backbends can help bring our spine back to neutral, stimulate natural energy, open our heart chakra, release tension, and improve our posture. This class is all about listening to your body to find your personal edge. Begin this 30-minute Hatha practice in Downward Dog. Then, prepare the body for movement with dynamic hip-flexor lunges and a quad stretch. Warm up the spine in Standing Side Bend before testing your balance in Crescent and Anjeneyasana Lunge Salutations with Cobra. Move through Warrior I and II and build toward your backbend with Camel, Bridge, Upward Bow, and an active rest before settling into your final Savasana. This class was previously recorded on December 3, 2020.

title: Post-Hike Joint Relief
description: Hikes got you weak in the knees? As much as we love a good hike, without proper recovery, they can cause some pesky knee pain. This active recovery class reduces tension and restores energy in the hips, legs and lower back. Begin with seated leg stretches (both held and dynamic), move into an active lunge series and wind down with supine openers. This sequence is great after a hike or any other lower-body intensive cardio workouts.

title: Complete Morning Vinyasa
description: This comprehensive and dynamic practice helps lengthen and strengthen the entire body. Jump right into it with Chair and Crescent Salutations with Dolphin before a challenging arm balance series with backbends. Don’t overthink it with this class, just get moving and allow your body to find its way!

title: Healthy Hips Hatha
description: Create length and strength in the full circumference of the hips and you hold poses. This class moves at a steady, thoughtful pace to actively engage the hips in each pose. Peak in a Crescent Lunge Hip Flexor Opener into Down Dog and Uttanasana Twists. Cool down with Cross-Legged Forward Bend and Reclined Twists. Today is day 16 of Glo's 30-Day-At-Home Yoga Challenge and this class was previously streamed on January 16, 2021.

title: Shoulderstand Hatha Practice
description:
Known as the “Queen of Asanas,” Shoulderstand is one of the most complex, yet most fulfilling poses in yoga. It leaves the body feeling refreshed and restored. This informative, alignment-based class is for experienced students looking to build up to Shoulderstand. Simple shoulder openers and back extensions warm up the body for Sun Salutes and Warriors. Learn “Shoulderstand Arms” during both Camel and Bridge, then pause to watch an informative demonstration. Practice your comfortable version of Shoulderstand for a full 3 minutes* (see disclaimer below) to soak in the legendary benefits of this pose—the “Fountain of Youth”. This class was previously recorded on November 17, 2020. Suggested Props: 1-3 blankets.

*Disclaimer: The information contained on Glo is of a general nature and cannot be a substitute for the advice of a medical professional. We urge you to consult with a physician or other health care professional before engaging in any physical activity, regimen, routine, program or exercise that may be presented in these materials. Glo does not give medical advice or engage in the practice of medicine.

title: Twists for Spaciousness
description: Create a sense of uplift and expansion that can be felt far beyond the postures. This steadily progressive, twisting flow begins with a shoulder-focused warm-up, then generates heat through Sun Salutations and Lunging Twists. Seamlessly transition into Revolved Triangle, Marichyasana 3, and Eagle pose, and hit your peak of Pasasana with variations that may not have been previously possible. Emerge knowing that your newfound spaciousness has been earned through patience and skillful practice. This class was previously streamed on November 27, 2020.

title: Vinyasa Flow for Circulation
description: This flow jumpstarts the body’s circulation process with steady, energizing poses. Wide-Legged Squats and Anjeneyasana Lunge Salutations get the heart pumping to flood the body with oxygen, while twists and side bends promote greater flexibility and strength. This class was previously recorded on December 10, 2020.

title: Forearm Balance Immersion
description: Learn the most thoughtful and effective way to practice and prepare yourself for forearm balance. This workshop-style flow includes updated and detailed techniques for this foundational but challenging arm balance. Begin with a shoulder-focused warm up, then build heat in the body with alignment-based sun salutations and standing postures. Move to the wall to experience 4 different shoulder variations of the pose that create strength and opening in the upper body. Complete your practice with Upward Facing Bow, a supine twist, and a well-deserved Savasana. Props Needed: A wall.

title: Spine Resilience Hatha
description: Having a strong and resilient spine is the foundation of a safe yoga practice, yet it's often compromised by the stressors it endures off of the mat. Give your spine the attention it deserves with a series of accessible twists, backbends and side bends. Begin by finding your center in bird dog, then methodically move your spine in all directions with revolved crescent, locust, forearm side plank, revolved wide-legged standing forward fold and gate pose. Finish with a seated twist and bridge pose, leaving your spine feeling healthy and strong. This class was previously recorded on November 6, 2020.

title: 10 Best Postures for Spinal Mobility
description: A rejuvenating Hatha class that utilizes a foam roller to teach 10 of the best postures that move the spine in all five directions to maintain a balanced, healthy range of motion. Props required: 1 foam roller.

title: Heart Opening Hatha
description: This feel-good practice will ease tension in the chest, upper back, and side body. Start lying down with a heart-opening pose, then warm up your shoulders and spine. Expand your heart in humble warrior and warrior 3 with your hands interlaced, then get a further opening in camel and side bow. This class was previously recorded on October 20, 2020. Props Suggested: A foam roller or bolster.

title: 10 Postures for Greater Hip Mobility
description: This Hatha class is all about the hips. Learn 10 postures to build strength and create more mobility in the full circumference of the hip joint—including the inner and outer hips and hamstrings. Peak poses include Reformed Low Lunge, Wide-Legged Squat, Half Monkey, and Wide-Angle Seated Forward Bend.

title: Strength & Stability Vinyasa Flow
description: This balanced rigorous flow works on building strength and stability throughout the entire body. Start by connecting to your center with one-legged Down Dog to plank repetitions, forearm plank and locust with glute strengthening. Flow though Crescent Lunge salutations and Surya Namaskar A, then weave in Boat pose, Low Boat, and prepare for arm balances with the seated variations of Crow, Firefly, and Side Crow. After a quick Surya Namaskar B, it's time to take flight. Collect your strength and willpower, taking the arm balances you practiced on your seat off the mat and into the air. Work your body from head to toe one final time in asymmetrical Locust, then finish with backbends and a gentle Supine Eka Pada Koundinyasana. This class was previously recorded on November 13, 2020.

title: Core-Focused Hatha
description: This balanced practice is a great core strengthener for all levels. Begin with reclined abdominal work and Plank variations, move through Lunge salutations, then challenge your core with half and full Boat Pose and reclined versions of arm balances. This class was previously recorded on September 29, 2020.

title: Wake Up & Go Vinyasa Flow
description: This comprehensive, whole-body practice will create more flexibility, strength, and focus for your entire day. Begin with downward dog to plank and dynamic low lunges before moving into a series of lunging salutations featuring core work, warrior 2, and half moon. This class was previously recorded on October 27, 2020.

title: Beat Burnout
description: If you're feeling stressed, overwhelmed, and burnt out, this class will help you move your body in a way that replenishes your energy. Begin with simple seated stretches, flow back and forth between down dog and plank, then move gently through sun salutations with warrior 2, triangle, and side angle repetitions. Refresh your body with your choice of inversions, then close with pigeon and a forward bend before you rest in savasana. This class was previously recorded on September 8, 2020.

title: Vinyasa Flow for Mental Clarity
description: Focus your cluttered or stressed mind by practicing grounding actions in a variety of balancing postures. Warm-up with lunges then keep up a steady pace as you test your focus in warrior 3, standing ankle-to-knee pose, revolved half moon, and utthita hasta padangusthasana 3. Close with single-leg bridge work and a feeling of mental clarity. This class was previously recorded on October 15, 2020.

title: Hip Release for Self-Care
description: This slow, grounding flow focuses on releasing tension in the outer hips and promoting self-care. Begin with seated cross-legged forward bends, a standing hip opener, and malasana, then flow through low lunge salutations, humble warrior with an outer hip opener, twisting pigeon pose, and twisting gomukhasana. This class was previously recorded on October 6, 2020.

title: Free Flowing Vinyasa
description: Pick up the pace with this brisk, yet technically precise, Vinyasa flow. This class will increase your strength, flexibility, and understanding of the Vinyasa framework while adding a playful sequence of arm balances. Deepen the connection between movement, breath, and peace of mind. This class will take you through several strengthening and stretching series before a final Savasana to bring this energizing practice to a close. This class was previously streamed on December 24, 2020.

title: Hip Release
description: Get a deep release throughout the full circumference of your hips, including your outer hips, quads, hamstrings, and hip flexors. Begin by finding dynamic motion in double pigeon, then explore lizard, horse stance, and figure 4 in chair pose. Tackle strength and mobility with 90/90 before getting deep into pigeon prep and gomukhasana, allowing any remaining tension to drain away. This class was previously recorded on August 24, 2020.

title: Backbend-Boost Vinyasa Flow
description: Give a boost to your day with a strong, energizing practice that will open your front body. Begin with a variety of lunge variations before exploring backbends in crescent lunge, locust, camel, both side and upward bow, and inverted staff pose. This class was previously recorded on September 17, 2020.

title: Twisty Vinyasa Flow
description: Unwind tension in your outer hips and back with a steady, energizing flow. Begin with seated twists and rotated boat pose, flow through sun salutations, then twist it out with revolved chair, a fresh take on revolved triangle, and a bound and rotated pigeon pose. Close with a bound wide-legged twist and savasana or meditation. This class was previously recorded on September 24, 2020.

title: After a Long Day of Teaching
description: This active, no-flow practice is designed to help teachers calm their minds and restore their bodies after a long day. Focus on accessible forward bends, hip openers, and inversions like shoulderstand and headstand. Close with a few minutes of meditation then take savasana on your own if you wish. Props Suggested: Two blankets.

title: Starter Arm Balances
description: Break down some of yoga's foundational arm balances in this workshop-style class. Practice making their shapes while on your back; briefly warm up with sun salutations, hip openers, and core work; then move to the wall to explore introductory versions of handstand, crow, and elephant trunk pose. If you're brand new to arm balances, this is the perfect place to start. Props Needed: Wall space.

title: Uncovering the Hidden Core
description: This strength-building flow will help you uncover the most overlooked, yet most important, components of your core. Work your lats, glutes, and obliques throughout crescent salutations featuring arm balances like eka pada koundinyasana 1 and astavakrasana. This is a strong practice for the midsection, hips, and legs.

title: Energizing Flow
description: Enjoy a steady, dynamic flow without feeling like you're rushing from pose to pose. This prop-free sequence includes a variety of lunges, warrior variations, twists, and backbends, including sugarcane and revolved sugarcane. This class was previously recorded on August 17, 2020.

title: Midday Yoga Break
description: This brisk, to-the-point class will move stagnant energy and alleviate any tension you've acquired from your day so far. Flow through poses that stretch your lower body and arms and twist your upper body. End with a brief release in a reclined backbend and supta baddhakonasana.

title: Sun Salutations for Energy
description: This balanced approach to sun salutations will keep you moving steadily with minimal instruction, so you can drop in deeply. Stoke your energy with enough variety to awaken your entire body and enough consistency to get you into the flow.

title: Morning Core
description: Get fired up as you wake up! This class will help you connect your movement to your breath, with an emphasis on activating and strengthening your core. Challenge yourself with boat pose variations, creative ab work that feels like crow and side crow on your back, as well as plenty of plank and forearm plank. Welcome to a strong and focused day!

title: Hips and Core for Active Beginners
description: Learn the fundamental poses and techniques for hip mobility and core strength in this active practice. Begin with dynamic stretching and crescent lunge sun salutations, get a deep stretch in half splits pose, and challenge your core and upper body in lolasana (pendant pose).

title: Return to Your Mat After a Break
description: It's perfectly normal to experience a practice hiatus, what matters most is that you return. This supportive, well-rounded sequence will show you the most effective, sustainable way to return to the mat while reintroducing the essential elements of your practice. Flow through Sun Salutations, Lunges, Sphinx into Forearm Planks, and Warrior and Triangle work, then take Half or Full Handstand at the wall before winding down with Bridge and twists. Props Needed: Wall space.

title: Morning Energizing Flow
description: This strong and steady flow will open and awaken your whole body, leaving you feeling balanced, energized, and ready to greet the day. You'll stretch out commonly tense areas like your quads, hip flexors, chest, and shoulders as you flow through a sequence including half moon, kapinjalasana, camel, and bridge, with a few arm balances sprinkled in.

title: On the Way to Upward Bow
description: This complete practice will skillfully guide you into backbends, culminating with urdhva dhanurasana (upward bow/full wheel). Learn exactly why each chosen posture helps prepare you for this peak backbend, including how teachers can effectively guide their own students toward upward bow.

title: Strength-Based Vinyasa Flow
description: This all-around, strength-building flow will work the full circumference of your core with revolved variations of poses. Create some heat right away then flow through lunge salutations and surya A's, weaving in boat, forearm side plank, fallen triangle, warrior 3, and side crow. Finish up powerfully with half locust and one-legged bridge lifts, then relax into a few reclined stretches and savasana. This class was previously recorded on August 31, 2020.

title: Strong Glutes and Hips
description: This balanced yoga sequence will work your glutes and outer hips to encourage greater lower-back stability. Expect sun salutations and classic Hatha poses, but with variations that focus on external rotation of the legs. You'll move through poses that strengthen the posterior chain and hip flexors, such as locust, a no-hands natarajasana, and one-legged bridge, then wind down with a couple hip stretches and a brief savasana.

title: Yoga For Men
description: This sequence was designed specifically for men, especially those with limited mobility in their hips, hamstrings, and shoulders. Learn to mobilize and strengthen these areas with dynamic movement instead of static stretching, then compliment your increased mobility by strengthening your core.
